Friends

class MediaManager

Detailed Description

Media player. Initialization of the resources is done in the constructor. Releasing of the resources is done in the destructor. In general, the methods of this class will return MediaManager::FeatureNotSupported if the corresponding feature is not supported, e.g. due to hardware constraints.

Member Function Documentation

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::FastForward (  INT  rate  )  [virtual]
 

This method fast-forwards the playback at the given rate. The audio output shall be muted during this period. When the fast forward ends, the application gets a notification (APOXI message).

Parameters:
rate [IN] The rate at which the fast-forward play should be played. It accepts values from 1 to 10. The default rate will be set to 5.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully starts the fast-forward play mode of the media file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

AudioReference * MediaPlayer::GetAudioReference (  void   )  const [virtual]
 

This method gets the audio reference of the audio system

Returns:
the audio reference of the audio system or NULL if there are any errors

BOOLEAN MediaPlayer::GetContinue (   )  const [virtual]
 

This method gets the continue flag of the apoxi audio system

Returns:
the continue flag of the apoxi audio system

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::GetPosition (  UINT32 &  position  )  const [virtual]
 

This method gets the current position (time) of the currently playing media file (in milliseconds).

Parameters:
position [OUT] Reference to a variable that will contain play position (in milliseconds)
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully gets the play position of the currently opened video file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Pause (   )  [virtual]
 

This method pauses the playback of the currently playing video file.

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully pauses the playback of the file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Play (   )  [virtual]
 

This method starts the playback of the currently opened media file at the current position (time), i.e. after invoking of pause API it resumes the playback at the position at which the playback has been paused. This API returns after the state becomes playing (in other words, the return is not after the completion of media playback). When the media playback completes, the application gets a notification (APOXI message).

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully starts playing the file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Rewind (  INT  rate  )  [virtual]
 

This method rewinds the playback at the given rewind rate. The audio output shall be muted during this period. When the rewind ends, the application gets a notification (APOXI message).

Parameters:
rate [IN] The rate at which the rewind play should be played. It accepts values from 1 to 10. Default rewind rate will be set to 5.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully starts the rewind play mode of the media file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SelectMediaTracks (  TrackSelection  track_selection,
UINT  audio_track_id,
UINT  video_track_id
)  [virtual]
 

This method opens the media tracks selected and adds the media framework components required for playing these tracks. Usually, this method is invoked before the playback will be started. If it is not invoked before the playback, then the first track in the media source is selected.

Parameters:
track_selection [IN] Selected tracks. (Audio only, Video only, or both).
audio_track_id [IN] Audio track Id as present in the media source.
video_track_id [IN] Video track Id as present in the media source.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media tracks open is successful, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the speaker balance to desired level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetContinue (  BOOLEAN  continue_flag = FALSE  )  [virtual]
 

This method passes the continue flag down to apoxi audio

Parameters:
continue_flag [IN] The desired continue flag
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the continue flag otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetDisplayLocation (  INT  x,
INT  y
)  [virtual]
 

This method sets the location of the video with respect to the canvas (video output window) where the video is displayed. The location is specified in pixel values relative to the upper left hand corner of the GUI object. By default, video appears at location (0,0). The location can be given in negative values or can be greater than the actual size of the canvas. When that happens, the video should be clipped to the boundaries of the canvas.

Parameters:
x [IN] The x coordinate (in pixels) of the video location.
y [IN] The y coordinate (in pixels) of the video location.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the location, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetDisplaySettings (  const DisplaySettings &  display_settings  )  [virtual]
 

This method configures the video output device. This method has to be invoked before the video playback can be started. In case that only audio tracks have to be played, this method is not mandatory before the beginning of the playback.

Parameters:
display_settings,: [IN] Display settings.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully configures the video output window, otherwise GeneralError

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetPlaybackContrast (  UINT  level  )  [virtual]
 

This method sets the Playback contrast to the desired level.

Parameters:
level [IN] The desired contrast of the LCD.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the LCD contrast to desired level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetPlaybackVideoQuality (  DisplaySettings::VideoQuality  video_quality  )  [virtual]
 

This method sets the Playback video quality to the desired level.

Parameters:
video_quality [IN] The desired playback video quality.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the LCD contrast to desired level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetPosition (  INT32  position  )  [virtual]
 

This method sets the position (time) of the currently playing media file to the positon specified by position (in milliseconds). It will not result into the playback of the media from the new position. So Play API needs to be called for starting the playback from this new position. Setting the position to values before the beginning of the track will effectively set the position to the beginning. Setting the position to beyond the length of the media will set the position to the end of media.

Parameters:
position [IN] The position to be set (in milliseconds)
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the play position of the currently opened video file, MediaManager::InvalidState: Indicates that the player is in invalid state (file not opened/tracks not selected), so cannot seek; otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetPriority (  UINT32  priority = 0  )  [virtual]
 

This method sets the apoxi audio to the requested priority

Parameters:
continue_flag [IN] The desired priority
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the priority otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::SetRepeatCount (  UINT16  repeat_count = 1  )  [virtual]
 

This method sets the Repeat Count and passes it down to apoxi audio

Parameters:
repeat_count [IN] The desired repeat count.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the repeat count otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

Parameters:
volume_level [IN] The desired volume level of the speaker ( 0 to 0xffff);
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the speaker volume to desired level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Stop (   )  [virtual]
 

This method stops the playback, resets the play position (time) to 0 and shows the first frame of the video file.

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully stops the playback of the media file, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Unzoom (   )  [virtual]
 

This method nullify the zoom changes caused by the Zoom method, i.e. it actually resets the zoom factor to 1. It shall be ignored if there is only audio or the video has not been zoomed. Note: Zoom factor 1 means that the whole video content is visible on the video out window (i.e. no clipping) but it does not mean that the video has to be in the same size (resolution) as in the media source, e.g. if the original video size is 352-by-288 pixels but the video out window size (see DisplaySettings) is 176-by-144 pixels, then the video is usually automatically downscaled to this size (if supported) and a zoom factor 1 would correspond to a 'real' downscaling factor 1/2.

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the zoom factor to 1, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaPlayer::Zoom (  BOOLEAN  zoom_up  )  [virtual]
 

This method changes the zoom level of the video. If the maximum upscaling factor has been reached and this method is called with zoom_up=TRUE, it shall be ignored. If the maximum downscaling factor has been reached and this method is called with zoom_up=FALSE, it shall be ignored. In case there is only audio, this method shall be ignored as well.

Parameters:
zoom_up [IN] If TRUE then the video shall be upscaled (to the next available level). If FALSE then the video shall be downscaled.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the zoom level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.
